text: I think about these things, but, you know, number 69 brings to mind to me Project 69, which was a grant awarded by the NAEB, the National Association of Educational Broadcasters from Washington, D.C., to Marshall McLuhan in order to undergo a study in understanding new media.

text: And that started off a culture and communication seminar they undertook.

text: which was an early interdisciplinary study of communication, which turned into, for Marshall and others, the birth of media studies, not simply communication studies.

text: The enlarging of this category from simple communication to media, to all human innovation and its effects.

text: The second very important grant was this NAEB grant, which gave Marshall the resources to undergo serious study of technology and media.
